column4: does anybody know anything about ndiswrapper? i've been screwing around with it for hours now and still can't get my USB network adapter to work
ndiswrapper tends to flake on USB adapters. Do you know what chipset it uses?
as a matter of fact, i do, hold please
i have 2 inf drivers installed for this adapter and they both appear to be working fine
iwconfig only lists lo, eth0, eth1 and sit0, no wlan0 :(
nope, for all of those it says no wireless extensions
that seems to be the response im getting from everybody, what should i do now?
Check to see if there is a non-ndiswrapper driver for your Atheros chipset.
this driver is the windows driver from the dlink website...
That would be what I refer to when I say an ndiswrapper driver. Find one written for Linux.
Asymmetry ok and when i do what am i going to do?
it's probably in the form of a kernel module. wpa_supplicant supports madwifi drivers (Atheros) if you need WPA support.
